intro: Oxybaphus aggregatus, commonly known as the clustered oxeye, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Oxybaphus aggregatus is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive blooms.
